column2: "Are you an ARKS member? Are you willing to accept my request?"
"Thank you so much. You're really a life saver!"
"I'm a research student studying the formation of the planets. It's just that I can't find much data on Naberius."
"It's the first planet ARKS go to for training, and yet there's very little information available on it."
"Sorry, I'm getting ahead of myself. My name is Rogio."
"The content of my request is very simple: a geological survey of Naberius."
"I have a hunch that I really want to look into."
"I've asked other ARKS, but they don't seem to think there's anything new to be learned about Naberius."
"And then you came along, <%me>. Thank you so much!"
"Please, whenever you have the time is fine!"
"<%me>, I was just thinking about contacting you."

"It's about my research into Naberius...
I gave it some thought, and I need more data."
"Since you know the situation already, I thought it would be best to ask you."
"You gathered more than enough forest data before. This time I need some data from the tundra."
"A lush forest being right next to a frozen tundra seems paradoxical to begin with."
"But it's obviously there, so we have to accept that. I just have an odd feeling about it."
"I can't find any records about how it formed. It almost looks like ARKS are trying to hide something."
"Ah. Sorry. As a researcher, I need facts, not opinions."
"If I have doubts, then the only way to find out what's going on is to investigate."
"Sorry to trouble you again, but I'm counting on you."
